did.abstract: Collection consists of correspondence of a Baltimore belle, including personal letters from her young friends in Charles Town, W. Va., and in York, Pa., with comments on social life and customs. Topics include dances and courting by beaus. One of the York letters tells of the Confederate invasion and compliments the orderly conduct of the soldiers; another speaks of the numbers of young men leaving for the army.
